abstract: Three Brazilian doctors are each sentenced to 17 years and 6 months in prison, after being convicted in the deaths of patients whose kidneys were removed and used for transplants at a private clinic.
snippet: A jury convicted three Brazilian doctors of killing four patients by removing their organs, which prosecutors said were used for transplants at an expensive private clinic.
lead_paragraph: A jury convicted three Brazilian doctors of killing four patients by removing their organs, which prosecutors said were used for transplants at an expensive private clinic.

headline.main: Brazil: Doctors Convicted of Killing Four Patients for Their Kidneys
headline.print_headline: Brazil: Doctors Convicted of Killing Four Patients for Their Kidneys
headline.seo: Brazil: Doctors Convicted of Killing Patients for Their Kidneys
